name: Autonomy or control? An agent-based study of self-organising versus centralised task allocation
description: The aim of our model is to investigate the team dynamics through two types of task allocation strategies, with a focus on the dynamic interplay between individual needs and group performance. To achieve this goal, we have formulated an agent-based model (ABM) to formalize Deci & Ryan’s self-determination theory (SDT) and explore the social dynamics that govern the relationship between individual and group levels of team performance.
referencePublication: "Autonomy or control? An agent-based study of self-organising versus centralised task allocation. " — Accepted by the Journal of Computational Social Science.
